definitions.title: dawn
definitions.body: ;—abs. ´[[שׁ]]: 1Sa 9:26 +, [[שָָׁחַר]] Ju Jdg 19:25 +; sf. [[שַׁחְרָךְ]] Is 47:11 (but read prob. [[שַׁחֲדָהּ]]);—dawn, c. [[עָלָה]] rise Ge 19:15, Ge 32:25, Ge 32:27, Jos 6:15 (all J), Ju Jdg 19:25, 1Sa 9:26, Ne 4:15, Jon 4:7; opp. [[עֵיפָה]] Am 4:13; as adv. at dawn Ps 57:9 = Ps 108:3; [[עַפְעַפֵּי־שׁê]] Job 3:9, Job 41:10; ´[[כַּנְפֵי־שׁ]]: Ps 139:9; Ps 110:3 rd. prob. ´[[רֶחֶם שׁ]]: (v. [[מִשְׁחָר]] infr.); ´[[שׁ]]: also Job 38:12, in sim. Ho 6:3 (but rd. [[כְּשַׁחֲרֵנוּ כֵּן נִמְחָאֵהוּ]] as inf., v. following, Gie:Beitr. 208 We Now GASm Marti), Is 58:8, Ct So 6:10, Joe 2:2 (al. blackness, ‖[[עָנׇן וַעֲרָפֶל ]]); ´[[בֶּן־שׁ]]: Is 14:12 (of star, fig. of royal splendour;—lit. as myth RS:K 300); ´[[אֵין לוֹ שׁ]]: Is 8:20 is obscure, so also ´[[בַּשּׁ]]: Ho 10:15 (We in storm, i.e. [[בַּשַּׂעַר]]).—Is 47:11 usu., but improbably, dawn (origin) of calamity: JHMich Hi Ew Röd (Thes) De Di al. charm away (RVm) (Ar. sah.ara enchant (We:Heid. 2. 159, 200), sih.run enchantment [= Sab. [[סחר]] DHM:Hofmus. 24. 1]); but v. [[[שָׁחַד]]]. p. 1005
